meanings.definition: The state or quality of being wiry.
meanings.sent1: Her wirinesses made her a great climber.
meanings.sent2: The wirinesses of the rope helped it hold the heavy load.
meanings.sent3: The wirinesses of the spaghetti were so tangled, it looked like a messy nest.
meanings.sent4: His wirinesses in negotiations helped him navigate tricky situations with ease.
meanings.sent5: The wirinesses of the old tree branches seemed to reach out like fingers in the wind.

meanings.sent1: The wirinesses of the fabric made it durable for outdoor use.
meanings.sent2: His wirinesses in personality made him stand out in the crowd.
meanings.sent3: The wirinesses of the electrical wires seemed to dance in the wind.
meanings.sent4: Her wirinesses in sports gave her an advantage in agility.
meanings.sent5: The wirinesses of the brush bristles helped clean hard-to-reach corners effectively.
